name: Roasted Eggplant Curry with Chickpeas
description: Roasted Eggplant Curry with Chickpeas is a great way to use up summer produce. Made with coconut milk, easy roasted eggplant and the perfect blend of spices!
recipeIngredient: 1  red bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 teaspoon garam masala OR use curry powder (*I prefer garam masala but curry powder works)
2 teaspoons fresh ginger, grated (*or use 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger)
1 teaspoon  salt, or more to taste
1/2 cup fresh chopped cilantro or parsley
4 cups cooked white or brown rice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly oil a large rimmed baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly oil a large rimmed baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the tops off of the eggplant, then chop into 1 inch cubes. There is no need to peel the eggplant, unless you prefer to.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the tops off of the eggplant, then chop into 1 inch cubes. There is no need to peel the eggplant, unless you prefer to.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the eggplant chunks to the baking sheet, and drizzle with 3 tablespoons of olive oil. Stir to coat the eggplant in the oil, then spread out and sprinkle with a salt. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the eggplant is tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the eggplant chunks to the baking sheet, and drizzle with 3 tablespoons of olive oil. Stir to coat the eggplant in the oil, then spread out and sprinkle with a salt. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the eggplant is tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, in a large skillet, add the 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sauté the onion and red bell pepper for 4-5 minutes, until translucent and soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, in a large skillet, add the 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sauté the onion and red bell pepper for 4-5 minutes, until translucent and soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Now stir in the spices: coriander, smoked paprika, turmeric and garam masala (or curry powder). If the mixture gets too dry, add a few tablespoon of water to de-glaze the pan a bit. Cook for about 1 minute, then add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 more minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Now stir in the spices: coriander, smoked paprika, turmeric and garam masala (or curry powder). If the mixture gets too dry, add a few tablespoon of water to de-glaze the pan a bit. Cook for about 1 minute, then add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 more minute.

recipeInstructions.text: To the skillet, add the canned diced tomatoes, coconut milk and chickpeas. Stir. Once the eggplant is done roasting, add to the skillet as well and stir in. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 15-20 minutes. Add salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: To the skillet, add the canned diced tomatoes, coconut milk and chickpeas. Stir. Once the eggplant is done roasting, add to the skillet as well and stir in. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cook for 15-20 minutes. Add salt to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over cooked rice, fresh chopped cilantro/parsley and perhaps a side of vegan naan if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve over cooked rice, fresh chopped cilantro/parsley and perhaps a side of vegan naan if desired.

keywords: chickpea eggplant curry, eggplant curry, vegetarian curry
